Dear Tia M. Cobb:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 2 allegedly started punching Youth A after Youth A hit him
with a toilet plunger.
Investigation I spoke to Administrator 1 on 3/11/24 via telephone.
Administrator 1 reported there is video of the situation and Staff 2
did hit Youth A. Staff 2 was placed on administrative leave.
I spoke to DHHS Worker 1 on 3/11/24. Allegations and
scheduling were discussed.
I left a message for Complainant 1 on 3/11/24. Complainant 1
has not returned the phone call.
Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility on 3/13/24
with DHHS Worker 1.
Interviews:
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported he was in the unit alone with Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C completing youth phone calls. Youth A became upset
during his phone call. Staff 1 took the phone from Youth A and
Youth A lunged at him and attempted to physically attack Staff 1.
Staff 1 put his arms and hands out maintaining distance from
Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A picked up a toilet plunger that
was sitting out in the unit and began to swing it at him. Staff 2
came into the unit to help and stood between himself and Youth A.
At some point Youth A punched Staff 2 in the face. Staff 1
reported Staff 2 then “launched” himself at Youth A and started
swinging punches on Youth A. Staff 1 was unsure if those
2

punches actually hit Youth A, but he reported he had to physically
separate Youth A and Staff 2 from each other twice. Staff 1
reported he was able to separate Youth A and Staff 2. Once
separated, Supervisor 1 came into the unit and Staff 2 left the unit.
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported he was working in a different unit that day and
was leaving the gym when he saw Youth A attempting to
physically assault Staff 1. Staff 2 entered the unit and stood
between Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Youth A then
started swinging a stick (toilet plunger) at him. Staff 2 reported
Youth A punched him in the face and then Staff 2 reported he
started fighting Youth A. Staff 2 reported he punched him in the
body area and in the face. Staff 2 reported after he hit Youth A
twice, Youth A fell to the ground and Staff 2 reported he continued
to punch Youth A. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 attempted to diffuse the
situation. Staff 2 reported he was separated from Youth A. Staff 2
reported a supervisor (unknown) came into the unit and then Staff
2 left.
Youth A and Youth C:
Youth A and Youth C refused to talk to both DHHS Worker 1 and
myself.
Youth B:
Youth B reported he doesn’t remember the incident in question.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the Incident Report dated 3/7/24. The incident report
is consistent with Staff 1 and Staff 2 interviews.
I reviewed the Medical Assessment dated 3/8/24. Youth
reported he was “punched in the face by staff. Youth denies any
current pain.” The findings by the nurse: “No verbal or nonverbal
indications of pain. Speech clear, no dizziness, light headedness
or vomiting. Ambulating with steady gait. No reported injuries. Skin
intact, no apparent bruising, swelling, abrasions or lacerations
noted.”
I reviewed Staff 2’s personnel file. Staff 2 has completed all
training, and all clearances were completed. There is no
disciplinary action in his file.
3

Video Review:
The incident started at 6:42:41pm on 3/7/24 and ended with Staff
2’s involvement at 6:45:22pm. The incident occurred in the unit.
Youth A is seen attempting to hit Staff 1 with a plunger. Staff 1 is
attempting to get the plunger from Youth A. Staff 2 enters at
6:43:18pm. Youth A began to slam the plunger on the table,
breaking the rubber part of the plunger and leaving only the
wooden stick. Staff 2 goes between Staff 1 and Youth A. At
6:44:39pm Youth A hits Staff 2 and Staff 2 then physically attacks
Youth A, punching him minimally ten times in either the face or
body area. Staff 2 also pushed him up against the wall. Supervisor
1 enters the room in attempt to deescalate the situation, but to no
avail. At 6:45:22pm, Staff 2 leaves the unit.
Analysis Staff 2 used corporal punishment by punching and pushing Youth
A. This was evident in the video watched at the facility and
confirmed by both Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2022C0108032; Dated 8/10/22; CAP Approved 8/30/22.
Rule Code Program Statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents needs, implementation of treatment plans,
and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings
Type
Allegation Staff 1 did not follow the agency phone policy, allowing Youth A to
access inappropriate social media.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported before the incident occurred on 3/7/24, he was
completing phone calls with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C in the
small room in the unit. Staff 1 reported he gave the I-phone to
4

Youth A and left the room to look for shirts that the youth stated
were missing. Staff 1 reported he was away from them for about
three minutes. When he came back into the small room, Youth A
was on the phone, facetiming a woman. Staff 1 reported he was
supposed to be in the room with the youth when completing phone
calls. Staff 1 reported he should not have left them alone with the
phone and knows that it is policy to be with them.
Youth A and Youth C refused to be interviewed.
Youth B reported he could not remember any events for that day.
Documents:
I reviewed the Youth Phone Calls Policy:
“All phone calls will be monitored with the exception of calls with
an attorney or referring agency worker.”
Analysis Staff 1 acknowledged he did not follow the agency phone call
policy and left the youth unsupervised with the phone for minimally
three minutes.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
